title: Preston Athletic F.C.
text:
Preston Athletic Football Club are a <a href="Scotland">Scottish</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club based in the town of <a href="Prestonpans">Prestonpans</a>, <a href="East%20Lothian">East Lothian</a>. The club are nicknamed the Panners and play their home matches at <a href="Pennypit%20Park">Pennypit Park</a>. The team play in dark blue.
They were founding members of the <a href="Lowland%20Football%20League">Lowland Football League</a> in 2013, but after being relegated in 2017 now play in the .
History.
Founded in 1945, they were originally a <a href="Scottish%20Junior%20Football%20Association">junior</a> club and only entered the senior ranks in 1994 when they joined the <a href="East%20of%20Scotland%20Football%20League">East of Scotland Football League</a>. As a full member of the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20Association">Scottish Football Association</a>, Preston are automatically eligible to enter the <a href="Scottish%20Cup">Scottish Cup</a>. They first qualified for the competition proper in <a href="2002%E2%80%9303%20Scottish%20Cup">2002–03</a>, losing 1–0 at home to <a href="Hamilton%20Academical%20F.C.">Hamilton Academical</a> in the First Round.
The club applied unsuccessfully to join the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League">Scottish Football League</a> in 2000 and 2002. In 2008 Preston Athletic were one of five clubs to prepare an application for entry into the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League">Scottish Football League</a> following <a href="Gretna%20F.C.">Gretna</a> relinquishing their league status, however they were again unsuccessful after losing out to <a href="Annan%20Athletic">Annan Athletic</a>.
At the end of the <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20Lowland%20Football%20League">2016–17 season</a> Preston Athletic were relegated to the East of Scotland League, having spent four seasons in the Lowland League.
Honours.
<a href="East%20of%20Scotland%20Football%20League">East of Scotland Football League</a> First Division
King Cup
Alex Jack Cup
Notable players and coaches.
The first professional coach of Preston Athletic was <a href="Paddy%20Buckley">Paddy Buckley</a>, a former <a href="Aberdeen%20F.C.">Aberdeen</a> and <a href="Scotland%20National%20Football%20Team">Scotland</a> striker whose son, Paddy Junior went on from Preston Athletic to play for <a href="Third%20Lanark">Third Lanark</a>, <a href="Wolverhampton%20Wanderers">Wolverhampton Wanderers</a>, <a href="Rotherham%20United">Rotherham United</a> and <a href="Sheffield%20United">Sheffield United</a>.
